oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Packing Kitty Litter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: An employee packaging bags of Lowe's Kitty Litter at a factory, likely Russell Pottery.

Edward Lowe (1920-1995) was a Michigan entrepreneur who invented clay cat litter in 1947. Marketing the product as "Kitty Litter" and later also as "Tidy Cat," Lowe expanded his business into a billion-dollar industry by the time of his death. In 1951, he moved litter packaging of litter to the facilities of Russell Pottery in Paris, to be closer to the source of clay. He later purchased two more Paris-based clay manufacturing businesses, Southern Clay Co. in 1965 and The Tennessee Absorbent Clay Co. in 1966.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cat litter industry; Clay industries--United States
